p: China has the highest incidence of HFRS worldwide. Our study area in central China, Hu County, is one of the main epidemic areas and serves as a national surveillance site to monitor the HFRS situation. Since 1984, a unique longitudinal field study of hantavirus in rodents with additional epidemiological tracking of human incidence has been conducted in the area ( Fig 1A). From 1994 onwards, an attempt has been made to control hantavirus transmission through the targeted routine vaccination of adults aged 16 to 60 yrs. old. Despite these control efforts, the dominant hantavirus (HTNV) continues to infect humans, with dynamics exhibiting clear seasonal and interannual variability as outbreaks invariably coincide with the end of the two rainy seasons ( Fig 1B).
